title: Do I need to develop my personality? - Quora

response.answer_text: Improving one’s personality is vital in today’s era. First of all I would like to clear the meaning of personality. Personality of any person does not mean the clothing, that most people thought to be. But there are many aspects of personality. Again here, I am not talking about the bookish things that you will read. The real things that would get noticed in one’s personality. I will one by one judge those factors Appearance. Yes the fist thing that get noticed in anyone and judged is the cloths we wear, how we look, shape of the body, cleanliness. As clear as it seems, You get dressed well in party, bride suppose to be the most beautiful. Thus, appearance matters a lot to get one’s attention. Communication. The way one speak is the second most important thing that gets noticed. Communication means how you say something, how you greet someone, how you affirm someone and you express your feelings. The moment you open your mouth, the listener starts noticing you. Yes, what you speak might be the next thing that gets noticed in someone, before it how you deliver what you want to say is that matters. Thoughts. The other major thing that may get you rejected or accepted by any group is what you thought about a particular topic. So, this will help you build an image in front of others and can also make a distance between you and others. So pay attention what you think. These are some of the things that needs attention with respect to your personality that must be paid attention to. These will definitely help you out to reach somewhere in your career and also in the personal and professional life.

Everyone has a distinctive personality. Our personalities make a big difference on how we move in our life. Our personality is fully developed by the time we are 7 years of age. Our environment plays a big roll in the development of our personality. Our personality changes and further develops as we grow. It matures with us. There are benefits to having a good personality. A bad personality on the other hand is our downfall. You cannot not have a personality and still manage to function. Our personality is part of our ability to function.

Self-Development or personal development is the result of taking steps to improve yourself. ... Engaging in personal development helps us to improve soft skills such as: Being a good listener. Having more empathy towards others. For example: Being honest and taking responsibility for your actions are admirable qualities. ... Patience is a virtue and also a good personality trait. Courage will help you do what's right in tough situations. Loyalty is a good quality to possess, making others trust you. Go to my Profile and you can find all Personality Development material there...

I would like to say that our personality is a sum of our knowledge and experience. And as the years roll by, it’s necessary that we gain new knowledge and expose ourselves to new experiences so that we can grow as a person. The more knowledge you gain and the more experiences you go through, the more confident you’ll turn out to be in your approach to life. I would like to leave you with this quote from Bruce Lee: ‘ Flowing water never goes stale’.

You can't really ask a question like that on an online forum to people who don't know you.  That would be more of a question to ask a therapist or someone who knows you very well.  Although personality is very well established by about 7 years old, I believe that we can change and grow our personalities over the course of our lifetimes if we are honest, open-minded and willing.  What is helpful to doing this is being self aware about our issues and short-comings and then actively working on them.  For instance, if you know that you are not a naturally giving person, make the commitment to do some volunteer work for 3 months.  New experiences open doors and promote change!  In large part, we are what we do.  And when we step out of our "comfort zone", we can grow and change.

One needs to develop personality to get out of their mundane details of life , to question their existence on this earth , for when one starts questioning their existence through their knowledge that one develops after developing their personality , one starts living fully and wholly on this mighty Earth.

It is possible to change considerably in your life - in coaching this is called 'Personal Transformation' - but you need to be honest about who you are, what you think and feel and how you want to be. When you start exploring that, authentically and congruently, you will start to change.  The question of whether you need to is not something that another person can answer - and it is a transfer of accountability to expect others to tell you whether you should. I encourage you to find the answer to this by asking yourself whether you are happy in life and/or want to be happier.

You would be getting lots of answer saying For better job, interaction, impression. But what i think is personality is what you are and living life in way you are(originality), is the way of living life, and day you will achieve you originality AGAIN will end all your doubts shyness, shame. So, personality is not for being a better representative, it is for living life purely.

DEVELOP personality??? You already HAVE a personality, whether it’s to your liking or theirs or not is quite another question. “Personality” is almost impossible to define because has so many possible features, from pleasantness to rage, jealousy to artistic, boring to dangerous. You could go ahead and name twenty more of these personality features and still not be done. You are already developing your “personality”, and it’s not finished yet, and it won’t be EVER completely finished, in my opinion, though the development does slow as we age, I believe.

Your personality is like a walking talking self-brand. Your style of talking, working, and handling things affect how people perceive you. Ultimately, you want to be in good books of people you either care about or people who could give you health and wealth. Having a strong personality always helps in shaping your career, building relationships, gaining trust, and attracting people.

My Dear friend! Thank you for your question. However, i would like to share that personality can not be developed. It can only be analysed and then retrospected upon. we tend to ignore our pants’s and elders’ advice tp study or to be in a good company, but we only analysed how important were those words when we learnt a lesson or lessons in life. so, our main focus should be to analyse our personality and hence, to work upon it as it said “not everyone get 10 number jersey” keep smiling keep shining’ 9717879813
